meanings.sent1: The broken clock was nonoperating and stuck at the same time.
meanings.sent2: The nonoperating computer screen displayed only a black screen.
meanings.sent3: The nonoperating toy robot seemed to be on a permanent break.
meanings.sent4: Her nonoperating phone felt like a useless brick in her hand.
meanings.sent5: The nonoperating car engine left them stranded on the side of the road.

meanings.definition: Not involved in the day-to-day operations of a business or organization
meanings.sent1: The nonoperating investor only checked in once a year.
meanings.sent2: The nonoperating board member rarely attended meetings.
meanings.sent3: The nonoperating CEO was more interested in golf than the company.
meanings.sent4: Her nonoperating role allowed her to focus on other projects.
meanings.sent5: The nonoperating shareholder had little say in company decisions.
